posts.post_content:
I think RDW is slowly including black I heard they're including cards like blightning. If that's true, this is gonna be pretty good with cards like ball lightning and hellspark elemental, since those guys die anyway. It can also act as removal if you're really desperate (say a baneslayer is kicking your \*\*\*). And of course if you have enough dragons, the ultimate (which can be used once it hits the field) ends the game.  
  
I think it's better than its current 2.5 rating.

posts.post_content:
This card has been underestimated. They actually emphasized him well with his current identity. His first ability really defines how far he's willing to go into madness in search of power and knowledge, despite the harm it will do to him. His second ability, if most of you think about it, not just it can change a few weaklings into 5/5 dragons (not to mention they can FLY), Sarkhan can make the 'mighty' Eldrazi (NOT yours, obviously) downsized, the real objective is to kill off their annihilating instincts been used against you. His ultimatum can be quite devasting if the plan is tactifully executed.
  
   
With 7 counters, you may use the 'Dragon-morphic' ability three times, and then use go for the 'MAD for knowledge' for a card since it it does not have a cost for loyalty, since it only state how much damage Sarkhan will be dealt.
  
   
Let's face it. The Eldrazi do seem great and powerful, but even they are useless if they can't be put into effect/play, or protect their owners from the l... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: AngelxLegna clearly has no mind of his own, at pre-release decks with Sarkhan were winning more than decks with Gideon : ) Oh, and for others who are still thinking about hating on this card, think of the card advantage this gives to the already card advantage heavy Jund. Turn 5, I drop Sarkhan the Mad. I have a Thrinax on the field, I use his -2. Thrinax hits the graveyard, I got 3 1/1 Saporlings AND a 5/5 flyer out of the deal. Sarkhan the Mad is amazing, pure and simple.

I honestly think this is extremely underrated right now, and Gideon Jura is overrated simply because control players are starved to hell. I'm not going to go into magical christmasland with dream scenarios about 20 dragons in play and you use Sarkhan the Mad's final, but he's very useful for taking out Eldrazi and certain 5/5 flying lifelinking first striking angels. At this week's FNM, my opponent was on the play and on his turn 5 he sacced all his spawn tokens and made a Spawnsire of Ulamog.. On my turn I dropped Sarkhan the Mad and converted it into a 5/5 dragon. Needless to say, he was ***ed. Very useful utility card, and I expect him to see a lot of play.


@TheWrathofShane,

Nissa can only be used in Elf decks, Sarkhan 1.0 can only be used well in aggro decks, Jace 1 and 2 can only be used well in control decks, Gideon can only be used well in control\midrange decks, Ajani and Elspeth are only "r... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Well, If I ever get the cards, I'd like to make a "Sarkhan and Friends" deck.  
  
I like SorianSadaskan's idea. Use [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) to turn an opponents creature into a dragon. Do that however many times you can afford. Play a [Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund) to gain control of their dragon(s), and voila, advantage = you.  
  
Then do whatever it takes to win. Turn yourself into a dragon to finish them off. Use [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad)'s ultimate to decimate somebody, swing with your dragon's, Whatever! JUST GO CRAZY! BWAHAHAHAHAHA--FIRE! FLY FORTH MY BEAUTIFUL DRAGONS! AAHAHAHAHAHAHA!--BURN! DESTROY! DECIMATE!

posts.post_content:
He's not the greatest planeswalker but overall hes pretty good. Many people are dismissing him right off the bat. He can change your bloodghast for a 5/5 flying dragon and still get your bloodghast back. I wished they gave him a +1 or +2 counter if you revealed a land from your deck for his first ability, if this happened he would have been pretty decent. He might make his way into jund, if they get broodmate dragons and a dragon off of a sarkhan, he becomes very brutal.
  
While magic has historically made very mediocre b/r gold cards (with the exception of bituminous blast, terminate, and blightning) hes a really neat idea that definatly has its uses, i just really wished they gave him 8 counters or that +1 idea of mine.

posts.post_content:
Much, much better than you'd think. Yes, he's unsustainable. That's fine! Magic is a race, and Sarkhan here gives you a huge boost.  
  
My usual plan is to drop him and go -2/-2/-2/0. Just think about that. \*\*\*uming you have creatures you don't mind losing (and playing R/B, I think that's safe), that's 3 5/5s and a card over 4 turns. If you imagine him as a slow 5 mana cantrip, you're starting to get it.  
  
On the other hand, if you've been diligent about working your opponent(s) down, you might not even need the other two dragons. -2/-4 could very well win you the game right there. Consider him now a two turn [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) that nets you a dragon to boot--not bad math either.  
  
If you're running Grixis colors, you can make an argument for simply using his 0 every turn, in conjunction with [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder) and the like ([Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) if you're really feeling extravagant) to avoid runnning into your [Cruel Ultimatum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cruel Ultimatum) ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: At first glance, Sarkhan 2.0 doesn't seem all that great. He may not be as versatile as other Planeswalkers, but he's an excellent addition in the right deck. If it weren't for the fact that he costs ~$20 a pop, I'd immediately grab two copies for my B/R control. The mana curve for my deck mostly falls between 0-3, so his first ability might as well read "0/-1/-2/-3: Draw a card". His second ability happens to be the one I like most actually. Swing with my [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) and you don't remove it? Then I'll just turn it into a 5/5 flyer and drop a land during my second main phase to bring it back. I can also turn my chump blocking [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir)s into formidable 5/5 flyers. Got some big, shrouded, or indestructible creature on your side? I'll just turn it into a 5/5 flyer and then [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate) it. His last ability is pretty so-so unless you have some tricks up your sleeve. At worst, it's -4 for a Lava Axe/autocard... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: This card is underrated...clearly not as good as Gideon, as Gideon is probably the 3rd or 4th best planeswalker in mtg history. But this guy can be devastatingly good, and this set made sure there are cards with nasty synergy with STM. Tuktuk the explorer is one of my favorite sarkhan fodder pieces (2 5/5s for sacrificing a 1/1), Mortician beetle should absolutely be run in a sarkhan deck. So many black cards have great going into graveyard abilities. In other sets, broodmate dragon and kokusha can inflict damage quickly w. sarkhan.
